meanings.definition: A type of fat found in the blood.
meanings.sent1: After eating, the body stores excess energy in the form of triglycerides.
meanings.sent2: Doctors check the levels of triglycerides in the blood to assess heart health.
meanings.sent3: The triglycerides in my blood were having a party after a big meal!
meanings.sent4: Her bloodstream was a river flowing with triglycerides, carrying energy throughout her body.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained that triglycerides are like little energy packages traveling in the blood.

meanings.definition: A molecule consisting of three fatty acids attached to a glycerol backbone.
meanings.sent1: The structure of a triglyceride makes it an efficient way to store energy.
meanings.sent2: During digestion, triglycerides are broken down into fatty acids for absorption.
meanings.sent3: The triglyceride molecule and its fatty acid friends were always together.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cells, triglycerides are like a three-piece fatty acid band playing sweet energy tunes.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the triglyceride looked like a tiny three-part puzzle waiting to be solved.
